page.title: 05FUEL SUPPLIES
page.content: Coal, gas, oil and electricity are the most common kinds of fuel used in this area.In Bunchrew caravan site (residential) they have coal fires and gas cookers.The gas is obtainable on the site itself, therefore saving the residents having to travel to Inverness. Most of the new houses have coal fires and electric cookers. Bunchrew is not a smokeless zone so wood is burned as well as coal. There are two houses in the village with oil heating. The houses on the outskirts of our block are near enough to have gas piped into them. Gas central heating is popular in these new houses.
